text: Strangely, the Genesis soundtrack is so much more atmospheric and creepy and better suited to the game. This is pretty cool but it just doesn't feel right in the game.
author: roundthewheel

text: The cartridge version has a couple really incredible tracks. I'd take that over ambient music any day. As a kid some of the Ecco music really made me feel the danger and isolation of the setting. Intense stuff, and etched into my memory :)

text:
"Ecco the Dolphin"
Oh. Oh, I get it. Ecco. Eco. As in eco-friendly. Ha ha ha. 
... Or it could be a reference to the Danish Shoe Manufacturer, ECCO...
author: Jirt

text: It's actually a reference to echolocation, which dolphins use to, well, locate things. In-game, Ecco uses it to talk to fellow sea denizens.

text: I totally agree. I actually wrote Spencer Nilsen a few years ago to thank him for the incredible work he did on this game. He was really happy to hear that people still enjoy his soundtrack.

text: This is really atmospheric.  Honestly, I prefer ambient music to energetic music.  It is easily more plentiful in my three calming vgm playlists.  Thanks for uploading this, Gabe.  It is with you and the other vgm channels I follow that I learn about games that I have never heard of like this one.
